# QaiTAlk Project - Application Guide for LLMs

This file describes the QaiTAlk project structure, resources, and conventions for Large Language Models to understand and navigate the codebase effectively.

Auto-generated: February 9, 2026

## ğŸ“‹ Project Overview

**QaiTAlk** is a full-stack Next.js application connecting mentors with job seekers. It provides blog content, curriculum resources, and the CV Review & Interview Preparation Tool.

- **Technology Stack:** Next.js, React, TypeScript, Prisma, PostgreSQL, Cloudflare
- **Repository:** QaiTAlk (workspace: c:\Users\tailo\OneDrive\Desktop\QaiTAlk)
- **Deployment:** Cloudflare Pages with D1 database

## ğŸ¤– Agent Skills & Customizations

The `.agents/` directory contains specialized workflows for AI-assisted development using the Awesome Copilot framework.

### **Tier 1: Reusable Frameworks**

#### feature-planning-workflow
- **Path:** `.agents/skills/feature-planning-workflow/`
- **Purpose:** Generic framework for planning any new feature
- **Output:** 9-document planning package (PRD, architecture, security, etc.)
- **Lines:** 1,200+
- **When to Use:** Planning major features like CV Review Tool

#### [Extends] cv-review-tool-planning
- **Path:** `.agents/skills/cv-review-tool-planning/`
- **Purpose:** Feature-specific quick reference wrapping feature-planning-workflow
- **Use For:** CV Review Tool feature planning

### **Tier 2: Operational Workflows**

#### blog-writing
- **Path:** `.agents/skills/blog-writing/`
- **Purpose:** Add blog posts with Prisma seed data and HTML content
- **Use When:** Adding new blog articles
- **Lines:** ~400

#### page-creation
- **Path:** `.agents/skills/page-creation/`
- **Purpose:** Create new Next.js pages and routes
- **Use When:** Adding new pages to the application
- **Lines:** ~350

#### database-changes
- **Path:** `.agents/skills/database-changes/`
- **Purpose:** Modify Prisma schema and create migrations
- **Use When:** Updating database structure
- **Lines:** ~400

#### component-patterns
- **Path:** `.agents/skills/component-patterns/`
- **Purpose:** Create React components following project patterns
- **Use When:** Building new components
- **Lines:** ~350

### **Tier 3: Discovery**

#### find-skills
- **Path:** `.agents/skills/find-skills/`
- **Purpose:** Discover and install agent skills
- **Use When:** Looking for functionality that might exist as a skill
- **Lines:** ~300

## ğŸ“ Prompt Engineering Patterns

Located in `.agents/prompts/`, these patterns guide how to structure requests to Copilot:

- **feature-planning.prompt.md** - Comprehensive feature planning requests
- **code-generation.prompt.md** - Clean, maintainable code generation
- **testing-validation.prompt.md** - Test writing and validation
- **documentation.prompt.md** - Clear documentation creation
- **refactoring.prompt.md** - Safe refactoring with confidence

**How to Use:** Copy the prompt template from the relevant file into Copilot Chat, customize with your task details, and run.

## ğŸ’¾ Planning & Design Documents

Located in `.agents/planning/` and `docs/ways-of-work/plan/cv-review-tool/`:

### CV Review Tool Feature Planning

- **prd.md** - Product requirements, user stories, scope
- **architecture.md** - System design, data models, component hierarchy
- **security.md** - Security considerations, compliance, data protection
- **implementation-plan.md** - Phased approach, milestones, effort estimates
- **testing-strategy.md** - Test cases, coverage requirements, scenarios
- **deployment-plan.md** - Release steps, monitoring, rollout strategy
- **database-design.md** - Prisma schema, table relationships
- **api-design.md** - API endpoints, request/response contracts
- **cicd-enhancement.md** - CI/CD pipeline, automation, testing

**How to Use:** Review relevant documents before implementation. Use as single source of truth for design decisions.

## ğŸ“š Project Documentation

Located in `docs/` directory:

### Core Guides
- **DEVELOPMENT.md** - Development workflow, setup, running tasks
- **DATABASE.md** - Database schema, migrations, data management
- **PROJECT_STRUCTURE.md** - Folder layout, file organization
- **TESTING.md** - Testing strategy, test execution
- **DEPLOYMENT.md** - Deployment process, environments
- **CI-CD.md** - Continuous integration and deployment
- **ACCESSIBILITY.md** - Accessibility standards (WCAG 2.1 AA)
- **SECURITY.md** - Security practices, environment variables
- **PRODUCTION_READINESS.md** - Production checklist

### Design & Standards
- **DESIGN.md** - Design system, component library
- **SEO.md** - SEO strategy and implementation
- **BRANCHING.md** - Git branching strategy

### Additional
- **QUICK_REFERENCE.md** - Fast lookup guide
- **GITHUB_SETUP.md** - GitHub configuration
- **ORGANIZATION_CHANGELOG.md** - Recent project changes

```

â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ migrations/               # Database migrations

â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ lib/
```

## ğŸ› ï¸ Technology Stack

### **Frontend**
- **Framework:** Next.js 15+ with App Router
- **Language:** TypeScript (strict mode)
- **Styling:** TailwindCSS + PostCSS
- **Components:** React (functional components + hooks)
- **Date Handling:** date-fns library

### **Backend**
- **Framework:** Next.js API routes
- **ORM:** Prisma
- **Database:** PostgreSQL (via Cloudflare D1)
- **Authentication:** OAuth2 (MentorFlow integration)

### **DevOps & Tools**
- **Deployment:** Cloudflare Pages + Wrangler
- **Testing:** Jest + React Testing Library + Playwright
- **Linting:** ESLint
- **Code Formatting:** Prettier (via ESLint)
- **Git:** GitHub with conventional commits

### **Development Setup**
- **Node.js:** v18+ (LTS recommended)
- **Package Manager:** npm
- **Environment:** TypeScript + strict tsconfig

## ğŸ“‹ Development Workflows

### **Before Starting Work**
1. Review `.agents/README.md` for skill overview
2. Check `.agents/context/quick-reference.md` for essentials
3. Review relevant planning doc for feature context

### **When Planning a Feature**
1. Use `feature-planning-workflow` skill
2. Generate comprehensive planning documents
3. Update `.agents/planning/README.md` with link

### **When Implementing a Feature**
1. Reference PRD from planning docs for requirements
2. Follow architecture design from docs
3. Use appropriate skill for task (page-creation, blog-writing, etc.)
4. Reference similar existing code patterns
5. Follow testing strategy from planning docs

### **When Debugging**
1. Check `.agents/context/common-pitfalls.md` for known issues
2. Review relevant planning docs for design context
3. Reference TESTING.md for test strategies
4. Consult relevant skill documentation

## ğŸ› Common Development Tasks

### Add a New Blog Post
- **Skill:** `blog-writing`
- **File:** Modify `prisma/seed.ts` with new post
- **Data:** Title, date, excerpt, content (HTML), author, tags
- **Schema:** See Prisma schema for Post model

### Create a New Page
- **Skill:** `page-creation`
- **Files:** New folder in `app/[route]/page.tsx`
- **Components:** Use components from `components/` folder
- **Styling:** TailwindCSS classes in JSX

### Update Database
- **Skill:** `database-changes`
- **Schema:** Edit `prisma/schema.prisma`
- **Migration:** Run `prisma migrate dev --name [description]`
- **Seed:** Update `prisma/seed.ts` if needed

### Build a Component
- **Skill:** `component-patterns`
- **Location:** `components/sections/` or `components/layout/`
- **Types:** Define props interface, return React.ReactNode
- **Testing:** Add tests in `__tests__/components/`

## ğŸ§ª Testing Guide

### Test Structure
- **Unit Tests:** `__tests__/components/` and `__tests__/lib/`
- **E2E Tests:** `e2e/` (Playwright)
- **Framework:** Jest + React Testing Library

### Running Tests
- **Unit Tests:** `npm run test` (Jest)
- **E2E Tests:** `npm run e2e` (Playwright)
- **Coverage:** `npm run coverage`

### Test Coverage Goals
- **Minimum:** 80% line coverage
- **Ideal:** 85%+ coverage with good branching
- **Critical Paths:** 100% coverage required

## ğŸ“Š Key Metrics & Monitoring

### Performance
- **Lighthouse Score:** Target 90+ on all metrics
- **Core Web Vitals:** FCP, LCP, CLS
- **Bundle Size:** Monitor with `npm run analyze`

### Analytics
- **Pageviews:** Track per page (blog, curriculum)
- **User Engagement:** Time on page, scroll depth
- **Conversion:** CV submissions, mentor bookings

## ğŸ”’ Security & Compliance

### GDPR Compliance
- User data encrypted at rest
- Data retention policy enforced
- User consent properly tracked

### Accessibility (WCAG 2.1 AA)
- All pages pass axe accessibility audit
- Proper heading hierarchy
- Keyboard navigation support
- Color contrast ratios met

### Authentication & Authorization
- OAuth2 via MentorFlow
- Session management
- Rate limiting on APIs
- CSRF protection

## ğŸš€ Deployment & Rollout

### Deployment Steps
1. Prep: Complete testing and code review
2. Build: `npm run build`
3. Test: Verify builds and test suites pass
4. Deploy: `wrangler deploy` to Cloudflare
5. Monitor: Check Cloudflare Analytics and logs

### Rollout Strategy
- **Feature Flags:** For gradual rollout (future)
- **Canary:** Test with 10% of users first
- **Gradual:** Increase to 100% over time
- **Rollback:** Have clear rollback plan

## ğŸ¯ Current Focus (February 2026)

### In Development
- **CV Review & Interview Prep Tool** - See cv-review-tool planning docs

### Upcoming
- Enhanced mentor matching algorithms
- Curriculum expansion
- Community features
